title: As a user I want to save a Place on 15-Day IL transaction for a player
custom_preconds: Given user have creating a place on 15-day IL transaction for a player
custom_steps: When clicking a save button will save the transaction
custom_expected:
THEN The system will  will reload the transaction in view mode
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.
AND A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode. 
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.  
AND Transaction will be in Post-Approval state only if Required field and format checks are made

title: As a user I want the Earliest Reinstatement Date calculated correctly on a 15-Day IL transaction
custom_preconds: Given user is creating a 15-Day IL Transaction for a player
custom_steps: WHEN user enter the placement date field on a Place on 15 -Day IL transaction
custom_expected:
THEN the system will calculate and display the proper Earliest Reinstatement Date. 
AND Earliest Reinstatement for a 15-Day IL placement will always be on the 16th Day after the Placement Date (including the Placement Date).

title: As a user I want to submit a place on 15-day IL to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: Given user has created 15 day-IL transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user open 15-day transaction in the status of  "preliminary"
custom_expected:
THEN Submit to BOC button is available to Club users when the preliminary or rejected form is in edit mode or view mode. The button is blue. 
AND Submit button is available for BOC users when the preliminary or rejected form is in edit mode or view mode. The button is grey.
AND Clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. 
AND Clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND After the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"
AND System reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification. 
AND Once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in Player's Player History: Code = IL15J, Description = Place on 15-day IL
AND From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields [required]
AND Entry appears in green font
AND Once the transaction has successfully been submitted, the system sets the player's pending major league roster status to "15-Day IL"

See Business Rules: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2351723

Messages: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2309676

https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2281404

title: As a user I want to be able to Cancel creation of or changes to a place on 15-day IL transaction
custom_preconds:
Given user has a IL Transaction submitted to BOC

cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 15 day IL
custom_steps:
Select a player from player history who has a IL Transaction Submitted to BOC 
Click on edit mode and click Cancel
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
* If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a Club user I want to receive a notification when my place on 15-Day IL transaction is approved, rejected or reversed
custom_preconds:
Given user is logged in as a Club user and is on notification clipboard

cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 15 day IL
custom_steps:
When a IL Transaction is move to Approve, Reject, or Reverse

See Submission Updates: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2351723

See Clipboard Rules (#2, #3, #4): 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2309008
custom_expected:
* Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Approved. 
* Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Rejected. 
* Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) will receive a notification when the transaction is updated to Reversed, unless the transaction is also Suppressed. 
* "Description" will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the description hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the place on the transaction in view mode in the same window/tab. 
* Player's name will be a hyperlink.
* Clicking on the player's name hyperlink of any of these notifications will open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse a place on 15-day IL transaction
custom_preconds:
Given user is logged in as BOC Approver

cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 15 day IL
custom_steps:
When there is a IL Transaction whose status is Approved

See Reverse Updates: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2351723

See Messages: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2309676
custom_expected:
* BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
* Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
* Successful reverse notification will be displayed. See Messages #79
* The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
* Display reversed transaction in player history with Voided: in front of the transaction description. Example: Voided: Major/Minor Outright
* Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode. 
* Clicking "Reverse and Suppress" will first reverse, and then suppress the transaction. 
* Clicking "Suppress" will suppress the transaction.
* When a transaction is suppressed it will be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI.
* Clicking "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress", will check if the current transaction is the most recent approved transaction. 
* If the transaction is not the most recent approved transaction for the player, then the user will receive an error message. 
Message "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
* User will ONLY have the back option. Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing place on 15-day IL transaction for a player
custom_preconds:
Given there is a IL Transaction√Æ for a player and it is an a preliminary or rejected state

cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 15 day IL
custom_steps:
When the IL Transaction in edit mode

Business Value: 
Allows users to make changes to an existing Place on 15-Day IL transaction. 

See Data Discovery: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2308147
custom_expected:
* Clicking Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode). 
* In Preliminary and Rejected, the Club and BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form.
* Edit only gives clubs access to attach new files in any state other than Preliminary or Rejected. Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
* BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions. 
* In Approved and Reversed (including suppressed) transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files, edit existing attachments, update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, as well as edit any other part of the transaction not specifically stated as not editable post-approval in the data discovery.
* Clicking Save will always reload the form in View

title: As a BOC user I want to see flags if certain rule checks fail
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 15 day IL
custom_steps:
Business Value: 
BOC users want to be warned if certain rule checks have failed. They should see these flags on the Approvals clipboard as well as on the form itself. 

See Flags #23.03: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2309213

Acceptance Criteria:
* BOC Approvers see Flags on a submitted transaction only if there is one or more flags set for the form. 
* Clicking on the flags icon opens a popover with the flags that are currently set for the form. (global functionality and styling)
* Flags display on the Approvals item if it is present.
* 23.03 - If the Exam Date entered on the transaction is more than 15 days ago, then the flag "Exam Date entered is more than 15 days ago." appears.
* Flags are dismissed on Approve and Reject.

custom_expected:
THEN the system will check to see if any submitted or approved place on 15-day MJ IL transactions are missing an attachment with the label "Standard Form of Diagnosis" that has a Roster Affected Date that is three or more days ago
AND if yes, an action item should be generated for the Player's Club MJ Transactions Admin according to the Clipboard Requirements

AND player's name should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the player's name hyperlink should open the player's profile in view mode in the same window/tab on the Player History tab

title: As a user I want to be able to add a new Authorized Signatory from a Place on 15-Day IL transaction
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 15 day IL
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=add_new_signatory_or_negotiator

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The Authorized Signatory field on the transaction will only contain a list of the Authorized Signatories with MJ Transactions checked off in the Auth Signatories widget, that belong to the Org for which this transaction is being done. (Org displayed on the transaction) 
* A "New" link appears above the Authorized Signatory field in edit mode if the user has edit capabilities for the authorized signatory widget. If they do not have permissions, the New link does not appear.
* Clicking "New" will launch a modal that allows the user to enter a new Authorized Signatory for the player's Org. 
* The checkbox associated with the form the user is adding a new signatory from will be auto checked.
* The Save button will be disabled until all required fields have been populated.
* Clicking "Save" will add the authorized signatory to the system and close the modal, with the "Authorized Signatory" field pre-populated with the newly added Authorized Signatory. 
* The Authorized SIgnatory will be added to the authorized signatory widget and will appear for the Org for all users that have permission to view that Org's Authorized Signatories.
* Clicking Cancel will cancel the addition of the authorized signatory, and return the user to the form.

title: As a user, I want the Last Game date to populate based on the player's Last Game Stats
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 15 day IL
custom_steps:
See Data Discovery: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2304294

Acceptance Criteria: 
* System will populate the Last Game Date field with the latest date that appears on the stats table for that player. 
* If more than one date appears on the stats table, the most recent date will be used. 
* All stats that appear on the the stats table will be used to populate the date. 
* If no stats appear for the player, the field will remain blank.

title: Place on 15-Day IL Permissions - Club - Major Transactions
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 15 day IL
custom_steps:
Roles and Permissions: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2304252

Acceptance Criteria: 
ADMIN: 
* Club users with this role can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
* Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Majnor League transactions for Major League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".


BASIC:
* Club users with this role can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

THEN if the user is a CLUB ADMIN the user should be able to view and print all Transfer to 15 Day IL(MJ) transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.

AND user should NOT be able to view transactions that are in Suppressed state

BUT user should NOT be able to see BOC Notes field for any Transfer to 15 Day IL(MJ) transactions
AND user should NOT be able to see the Comments field for any Transfer to 15 Day IL(MJ) transactions unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. (Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org)
AND user should NOT be able to see attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
AND user should be able to create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Transfer to 15 Day IL(MJ) transactions for Major League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

BUT if user is logged in as CLUB VIEWER
THEN user should be able to view and print all Transfer to 15 Day IL(MJ) transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too
BUT user should NOT be able to see Transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should NOT be able to edit or change these transactions (Viewer only)
AND user should NOT be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND club users with this role should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) Transfer to 15 Day IL(MJ) transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions 
BUT user should NOT be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should NOT see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND user should NOT be able to see attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: As a user I want to edit an existing transfer to 15-day IL transaction for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN a transfer to 15-Day IL transaction exists for a player
custom_steps: WHEN club or BOC user with edit permissions navigates to the form in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button should be available
AND clicking  Edit should reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button should appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode)
AND in Preliminary and Rejected, the Club and BOC users should be able to edit all portions displayed on the form
AND edit should only gives clubs access to attach new files(and check SFD checkbox if file is uploaded) and edit auth sig in any state other than Preliminary or Rejected. Club should not be able to edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction
BUT BOC should be able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions
AND in Approved and Reversed (including suppressed) transactions, edit should only give BOC access to attach new files, edit existing attachments, update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, as well as edit any other part of the transaction not specifically stated as not editable post-approval in the data discovery

title: As a user I want to save a transfer to 15-day IL transaction for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN a transfer to 15 Day IL transaction exists for a player
custom_steps: WHEN a club or BOC user with edit permissions has navigated to the form in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN a Save button should be available
AND clicking Save should save the transaction and it's current values and reload the transaction in view mode 
AND required field and format checks should only be made if the transaction is in a submitted or higher state
AND transaction status should be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status should not change
AND after a successful save the system should display a successful save blue notification. See Messages #77
AND whenever the form is in edit mode, the user should see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey

title: As a user I want to cancel creation of or changes to transfer to 15-day IL transaction for a player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
AND user is attempting to create a new Transfer to 15-Day IL transaction
OR user is attempting to edit an existing transaction
AND user has the form open in edit mode
AND "Cancel" button is available on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Cancel"
custom_expected:
THEN system should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made
AND if they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction
BUT f they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected
AND if they do not confirm the cancellation then the user should be returned to the form and no action should be taken

title: As a user I want to submit a Transfer to the 15-Day IL to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
AND user is attempting to submit a Transfer to 15-Day IL tx for a player
custom_steps: WHEN user has navigated to the form in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN Submit to BOC button should be available to Club users when the preliminary or rejected form is in edit mode or view mode. The button should be blue
AND Submit button should be available for BOC users when the preliminary or rejected form is in edit mode or view mode. The button should be grey
AND clicking Submit should run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message
AND clicking Submit should run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass)
AND after the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
AND system should reload the transaction in view mode, and display a successful submit blue notification. Messages #76
AND if the player's pending MJ roster status is Rehab 7 Day Concussion IL then their pending MJ Roster Status should be set to to Rehab 15 Day IL
AND if the player's pending MJ roster status is 7 Day Concussion IL then the player's pending MJ roster status should be set to to 15 Day IL
AND once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in green font in Player's Player History: Code = TRIL15J, Description = Transfer to 15-Day IL, From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields
AND when a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item should be generated and display on the BOC - Major Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget
AND if a file is attached to the transaction, that should be displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget
AND if Comments are populated on the transaction, they should display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget
AND player name should be a hyperlink in the Approvals widget
AND clicking on the player name should open the Player Profile (defaults to Player History tab) in the same window/tab
AND  "Type" should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction should open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab

title: As a BOC user I want to approve or reject a transfer to 15-day IL transaction
custom_preconds:
cba change, Injured list, mj IL - transfer to 15 day IL

GIVEN that BOC wants to Approve or Reject a Transfer
custom_steps: WHEN BOC is viewing a transaction(in view or edit mode) in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC or Rejected state.
custom_expected:
THEN
   APPROVE:
* BOC Approvers will see an "Approve" button in blue when Transaction is in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC and Rejected states.
* Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages.
* Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode.
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved. See Messages #80.
* If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard.
* Update Player's Player History: Code = TRIL15J Description = Transfer to 15-Day IL, From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields to be in black font.
* If the player√çs current MJ roster status is Rehab 7 Day Concussion IL, then set the player's MJ Roster Status to Rehab 15 Day IL.
* If the player's current MJ roster status is 7 Day Concussion IL, then set the player's MJ roster status to 15 Day IL
OR
   REJECT:
* BOC Approvers will see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction in the Submitted to BOC state only.
* Clicking "Reject" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages (all covered in previous stories).
* Once all On Save rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
* Successful reject notification is displayed. See Messages #78.
* If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard.
* Reverse player's pending Major League Roster status.
* Remove pending player history entry.
* Remove any action items that were generated regarding the transaction.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse, suppress or reverse and suppress a Transfer to 15-Day IL transaction

custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers should see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state
AND clicking "Reverse" should run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run
AND a successful reverse notification should be displayed. See Messages #79
AND the transaction status should be updated to "Reversed"

"Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed." 
AND user should ONLY have the back option
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction

title: As a user I want to see what Recertifications are due for a player on my Recertifications tab - 15 Day IL
custom_preconds: Injured list, mj - place on 15 day IL, recertification widget, ux-approval-na
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://w6h8fs.axshare.com/#p=recertification

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "Recertification Due" column will be populated with Recertifications that have or should have occurred, in a comma separated list (see wire). 

* For a 15-Day IL placement, the first Recertification Due Date will be 15 days after the placement date. The following will be 15 days after the first recertification due date and so forth. 
* Each 15 Day row will always show any Recertification Due dates that have passed, and the one that is next due that is in the future

title: As a user I want to receive an email when a player requires a IL Recertification
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, email, mj - place on 10 day IL, mj - recertify a player
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
*Note nothing is changing for this story from previously - just ensuring that this functionality still works with the change from a 15-Day IL to a 10-Day IL*

* The system should check nightly to see if any new players require a IL recertification. 
* If not, no action is taken. 
* If yes, then the system checks to see if "Send Emails" is set to Yes. 
* If yes, then the system checks to see if "Send Notification" is checked for Clubs for the "IL E-recerts" under the Transactions section of the Email Utility. 
* If yes, then an email notification is generated for the player's Org.
* The system also checks to see if "Send Notification" is checked for the BOC for the "IL E-recerts" under the Transactions section of the Email Utility. 
* If yes, then an email notification is generated for the BOC.
* The email should show the dates for all recerts that are still due for the player, separated by commas
* The email should follow the below example.

Example: 
From: e-bulletinsdev@mlb.com [mailto:e-bulletinsdev@mlb.com] 
Sent: Monday, September 26, 2016 12:52 PM
To: youremail@yourdomain.com
Subject: IL E-Recert

Matthew Holliday IL Recertification due 08/27/2016

title: As a user I want to receive a Notification for a player that is up for recertification or reinstatement
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 10 day IL, mj - recertify a player, nightly notification
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Using the same logic as #130338071, nightly the system will check if any Major League players currently on the 7 day Concussion IL or 10 Day  IL have a recertification due on the current date
* If a player is found to meet either or both of the above criteria, a notification is sent to the BOC- Major- Trans- Admin and Club  Major-Trans-Admin group that the player belongs to even if the user did not receive and email. 
* Date column is the Date the notification was generated 
* Type: Transaction
* Org: Org that the player belongs too 
* Notification Description: The Player is up for recertification or reinstatement by [date]

title: As a BOC user I want to be prevented from initiating a recertification for a player that has not been on the appropriate IL
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is in a Player's History page
custom_steps: WHEN user Selects "Recertification" on the Create New menu for a player from their Player History
custom_expected:
THEN
-System will check to see if the player submitted/approved transactions (IL07J, IL10J, TR10J, RECRT) from the current year which match (or post-date) the latest placement, transfer, or release tx. 
-If no transaction exists, the player is not eligible. If a transaction exists, the recertification date must be before the last game of the season.
**Message**
**Body:** "No re-certifications are required for this player."
**Button(s):** Back - Clicking Back will return the user to the entry point.
